How to Turn your E-commerce Business into a Brand

If we observe our shopping habits a little carefully, it seems obvious that we focus more on buying from big brands and ignore the smaller unknown ones. Ever wondered why such ignorance towards small business occur? Its because even if we do not know much about the product line, word of mouth from friends and family or increased visibility of those brands make them seem more reliable to us.


Branding is the art of becoming knowable, likable and trustable.

John Jantsch
Marketing Consultant
Specializing in Small
Businesses

In such a fast moving world as today, people want to be both confident about their choices and get things done fast as well. The easiest way to achieve both of these goals is to trust brands that are more knowable and likable by the general mass. As an e-commerce business owner, your goal should be to become the knowable and likeable brand that pops into ones head when theyre thinking of buying the product you sell. And were here to enlighten you with tips and tricks that would help you achieve this goal.


Tips and Tricks to turn your e-commerce business into a brand:

Target the right audience

Its obvious that you dont need your marketing plan to attract the entire population but rather it should effectively reach and attract the people who are most likely to buy from you. So your first job is to figure out your target market in order to be able to create personalized contents and campaigns for them. First try to figure out the common characteristics of your target group and create a buyer persona based on that. Conducting periodic surveys, studying the industry and observing the branding campaigns of your peer businesses may help you understand you target audience and their problems, needs and desires. While conducting these researches, your core focus should be to find out the platforms they visit regularly (Facebook, YouTube, Twitter etc.), the search terms theyre more likely to use and the reason to desire your product.

Mission and vision: Communicate your inner feelings

Before making or implementing any plan, its important to have clarity about both yourself and your customers. While figuring out the target audience provides you clarity about your potentials customers, your mission and vision helps create clarity about your business and yourself. Think about why you started the business in the first place. The motives that made your think about the need of the product and the feelings you want to convey to your customers through the products constitute your vision. Missions, on the other hand, are more specific. The represent your long term goals and describe the benefits and values the product will be adding to your customers lives. Visions create an emotional connection and missions provides a more strategies angle of the business and defines your brand. Plan them properly and keep them concise and easy to understand. All this is to create a connection with your audience, so there should be an alignment between your business goals and what the customers believes in. Also, its important not to exaggerate or lie about your business ideals, as customers will be able to see through if your actions dont match your words.


Content Marketing Strategy

Anything and everything your write on your website is a part of your content marketing strategy. In a physical store, you have the luxury to use spoken words to attract your customers. In online, the persuasion is done more through the written contents on your website and this is why, its important that you stand out. Start with the basics. The banner text, the page and service descriptions should be to the point and they should be reviewed and updated on a regular basis. Surely pictures speak a thousand words but that never vaporizes the importance of written words. So make sure you write realistic product descriptions including all perks and quarks of the product as customers today admire realism rather than having false hope. Its also a good idea to have a blog page where you would publish writings related to your line of work and industry as blog pages work great as traffic drivers and generate organic leads.


Visualize your Business!

If you enter a physical store and see its full of clutter and dust, what would you think? Seeing how disorganized the store is, you interest in its product may automatically go away. Its the same with online stores but instead of clutter and dust, its blur, low resolution or unprocessed photos that make that store looks of poor quality. Rule of thumb: never use unprocessed or low resolutions photos in your website.
Focus on creating a logo that represents your business and your ideals as logo is basically the face of your brand. Design multiple banners for your home page each with a Call to Action button leading viewers to different pages of your website. Needless to say, its always best to use real product photos and make sure you edit them properly as well.


Dont Stop the Contents!

Photos and write-ups are basic necessities to keep your website breathing and alive. While its important that you start your journey with them and always keep them on a check, its important to keep expanding you content collection with different varieties. Start with basic videos that explains your business to your customers. Then move to product demonstrations videos so people are more aware about its use in their lives. Other than that, periodically release infographics that informs your customers about ongoing trends, styles and other important current topics. Its also a good idea to hold regular podcasts as people will prefer listening than reading the contents you write. You can discuss the trends in your business, the blogs you publish, go for collaborations or bring in guests to keep retaining your customers attention.


Simply making these contents is not enough. You need to market them properly as well. Regularly post about them on your social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter etc.) as maintaining your visibility is a big part of branding. Keeping this in mind, only market your brand in those platforms where your customers are present. Always keep the out of sight, out of mind concept in head.

Dive in with E-mail Marketing

Youre doing great things in your business. Youre regularly uploading blogs, holding podcasts and introducing new collections that you know your customers are going to love. But are you customers being updated about these regular changes? You customers are already as busy as they can be and its silly to assume that theyll be regularly visiting you website to know about the new updates you introduce. Its your duty to let them know and the way to do that is through email marketing. Its best if you create a marketing calendar and plan your email marketings beforehand in accordance with the upcoming events, clearance or discount offers.


Resolution 7: Prepare a routine calendar of agendas

Operating an online business is not an easy task. You have to keep thousand things in mind and a huge time of your everyday working hour gets spent on filling daily chores. But getting too caught up on daily chores may hinder you from fulfilling your long term goals like- expanding your product line. This is why, its important that you have all your plans organized in one place along with a timeline for implementation.

The last resolution were advising you to have this year is one of the most important ones. First, prepare yearly agendas that you wish to fulfill in the upcoming years. The make you quarterly plans in accordance with that. Next, break it down to your monthly and weekly plans so you know what to do and when to do it. The gist of the resolution is to always have a plan and be on routine so you know youre always getting ahead and walking the footsteps needed to fulfill your long term goals. Always review and revise your plans to implement the necessary changes in them with changing time, plan and strategies.

New Year means new beginning at least thats the way we hope things are for you. The e-commerce world is clearly not a bed of roses. While the business provides you with its daily challenges and struggles, hard work and persistence brings you thrills and rewards that are worth fighting for. The resolutions we have explained in this blog are just to make the road youre taking less difficult and help make your goals seem more transparent.
